// Mock data for the right sidebar (replace URLs with actual logo paths) const mockPartnerLogos = [ { name: 'HeinOnline', src: 'https://via.placeholder.com/100x50?text=HEINONLINE' }, { name: 'ROAD', src: 'https://via.placeholder.com/100x50?text=ROAD' }, { name: 'Manupatra', src: 'https://via.placeholder.com/100x50?text=MANUPATRA' }, { name: 'Google Scholar', src: 'https://via.placeholder.com/100x50?text=GOOGLE SCHOLAR' }, { name: 'Harvard University', src: 'https://via.placeholder.com/100x50?text=HARVARD' }, { name: 'UC San Francisco', src: 'https://via.placeholder.com/100x50?text=UCSF' }, { name: 'UC Law', src: 'https://via.placeholder.com/100x50?text=UC LAW' }, { name: 'University of Saskatchewan', src: 'https://via.placeholder.com/100x50?text=SASKATCHEWAN' }, { name: 'Stanford Libraries', src: 'https://via.placeholder.com/100x50?text=STANFORD' }, { name: 'University of Southern Queensland', src: 'https://via.placeholder.com/100x50?text=USQ' }, { name: 'Northwestern University', src: 'https://via.placeholder.com/100x50?text=NORTHWESTERN' }, { name: 'International Standard Serial Numbering (ISSN)', src: 'https://via.placeholder.com/100x50?text=ISSN' }, { name: 'iUIS', src: 'https://via.placeholder.com/100x50?text=iUIS' }, { name: 'Advanced Science Index', src: 'https://via.placeholder.com/100x50?text=ASI' }, ]; const timelineData = [ { stage: 'Desk triage', timeframe: '48 hours' }, { stage: 'Reviewer assignment', timeframe: 'Within 24 hours post-triage' }, { stage: 'Review turnaround', timeframe: '5 days' }, { stage: 'AE synthesis & recommendation', timeframe: '3 days' }, { stage: 'Author revision', timeframe: '24–48 hours' }, { stage: 'Final checks & publication', timeframe: '2–3 days' }, ]; function SubmissionGuidelinesPage({ setPage }) { // Placeholder function for navigation buttons const handleNavigation = (targetPage) => { if (setPage) setPage(targetPage); }; return (
{/* --- LEFT COLUMN: MAIN GUIDELINES --- */}

MLS PUBLICATIONS — Submission Guidelines and Policies

{/* About the Journal */}

About the Journal

The **MLS Publications** is an advocate-supervised, early-career practitioners/student-edited, and **peer-reviewed publication** committed to advancing high-quality legal scholarship through innovation, integrity, and accessibility. This Publication follows a transparent, **hybrid review system** that combines **double-anonymous peer review**, AI-assisted screening, and post-acceptance community validation, ensuring fairness, speed, and real-world impact.

{/* Eligibility to Submit */}

Eligibility to Submit

Submissions are invited from:

  • Undergraduate and postgraduate law students, research scholars, and early-career professionals
  • Practitioners, academicians, and policy experts in law and allied disciplines
  • Interdisciplinary authors engaging seriously with legal reasoning and methods

Co-authorship is permitted for up to **two authors**.

{/* Categories of Submissions */}

Categories of Submissions

  • Long Articles (6,000–8,000 words): Comprehensive analysis of legal, regulatory, or policy issues with original reasoning and potential reforms.
  • Short Articles (3,000–6,000 words): Comprehensive analysis of legal, regulatory, or policy issues with original reasoning and potential reforms.
  • Essays (3,000–5,000 words): Focused argumentative pieces addressing emerging or conceptual questions.

Word limits exclude footnotes. Exceptional manuscripts may exceed limits if justified by depth and clarity.

{/* Submission Components */}

Submission Components

Each submission must include the following files (uploaded separately on the submission portal):

  • Abstract: A 250-word abstract summarizing the research question, methodology, and key findings. No author identifiers should appear in the abstract.
  • Manuscript / Script:
    • Must be fully anonymized (no author names or metadata).
    • Written in Times New Roman, 12-point font, 1.5 line spacing.
    • Footnotes (not endnotes) in 10-point font, single spacing.
    • Citations must follow **OSCOLA (4th Edition)**.
    • Submit in **.doc or .docx** format only.
  • Author Description & Plain-Language Summary (separate file):
    • Author Description: Name, designation, institution, research interests.
    • Plain-Language Summary (150–250 words): Simplified explanation of the paper’s significance and findings for practitioners and students.
  • Declaration Form: Confirms originality, absence of plagiarism, ethical compliance, and disclosure of AI tool usage (if any). Declaration format will be provided by the Publication.
{/* Anonymisation Requirements */}

Anonymisation Requirements

To maintain anonymous review:

  • Do not include personal details, acknowledgements, or self-identifiers in the manuscript.
  • Use “Author” and “Year” placeholders for self-citations.
  • Remove metadata: File → Info → Check for Issues → Inspect Document → Remove Personal Information.
  • Only the **title** should appear on the first page.
{/* Editorial and Review Process */}

Editorial and Review Process

The MLS Law Journal follows a **Hybrid Multi-Layer Review System**, combining fairness, rigor, and usability:

  • Stage 1 — Automated Intake & Screening: Submission checked for format, plagiarism (Turnitin), and basic language quality. Missing information results in immediate “Return to Author” with a 24-hour correction window.
  • Stage 2 — Managing Editor Review: Assesses scope and basic quality fit. Unsuitable manuscripts may be desk-rejected with feedback. Suitable manuscripts assigned to an Associate Editor.
  • Stage 3 — Peer Review Coordination: The Associate Editor selects 2–3 reviewers. Review follows a **double-anonymous** process using structured scoring rubrics.
  • Stage 4 — Review & Synthesis: Reviewers evaluate based on originality, reasoning, clarity, methodology, and ethical compliance. The Associate Editor synthesizes the reviews and recommends: Accept, Minor Revisions, Major Revisions, or Reject.
  • Stage 5 — Decision & Revision: Managing Editor issues a structured decision letter. Authors submit a point-by-point response within the specified deadline (minor: 24h; major: 48h).
  • Stage 6 — Community Validator Panel & QA: Accepted papers undergo review by the **Community Validator Panel** for clarity, reproducibility, and plain-language quality.
  • Stage 7 — Copyediting & Publication: Copyeditors ensure formatting, legal accuracy, and metadata integrity. Publication is accompanied by a **Publication Certificate** and open access availability.
{/* Quality and Timelines */}

Quality and Timelines

{timelineData.map((item, index) => ( ))}
Stage Timeframe
{item.stage} {item.timeframe}
{/* Open Access and Licensing */}

Open Access and Licensing

All works are published under the **Publications**, allowing free sharing and adaptation with proper attribution. Authors retain copyright but grant the Journal a non-exclusive, royalty-free license to publish and distribute their work.

{/* Ethics, Integrity, and Conflicts */}

Ethics, Integrity, and Conflicts

  • **Plagiarism:** Submissions with similarity >20% undergo human review.
  • **Conflicts of Interest:** Authors and reviewers must disclose conflicts.
  • **Corrections/Retractions:** The Journal maintains transparent post-publication correction and retraction policies.
{/* Publication and Print Policy */}

Publication and Print Policy

Publication in the MLS Law Journal is entirely free. No processing, review, or evaluation fees are charged at any stage of submission.

Authors are only required to contribute towards the printing and dispatch cost of the hardbound volume, after acceptance of their manuscript.

The contribution is as follows: Single Author: **₹1500** / Co-Authored (Two Authors): **₹1700**

This amount covers: The author’s complimentary hard copy of the published volume, Postage and dispatch costs, Administrative processing for the print edition.

The digital publication (open-access e-journal) remains free and accessible to all readers.

**Note:** The payment does **not influence the review or acceptance process**. All submissions are evaluated solely on academic merit under the Journal’s hybrid double-anonymous review policy.

{/* Contact */}

Contact

All queries and submissions should be directed through the online submission portal or by email to: **__________**

{/* Summary Workflow */}

Summary Workflow

1. Submit → 2. Auto-screen → 3. Managing Editor Triage → 4. AE Assigns Reviewers → 5. Double-anonymous Review → 6. AE Synthesis → 7. Decision & Revision → 8. Community Validation → 9. Copyedit → 10. Publication & Open Commentary

{/* --- RIGHT COLUMN: SIDEBAR --- */}

Indexing Partners

{mockPartnerLogos.map((partner, index) => ( ))}
); } export default SubmissionGuidelinesPage;
